alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving showers and thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall across northern portions of Okaloosa County. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches have likely fallen during the past hour in some locations. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will likely result in minor flooding of creeks and streams and in urban and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crestview, Baker, Silver Springs, Auburn, Garden City, Campton, Clear Springs, Killingsworth Crossroads, Milligan, Peaden, Deerland, Okaloo, Dorcas, Nubbin Ridge, Cannon Town and Blackman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
